>>33751279
What's very, very interesting to me is that Joyboy/Nika, as a entity, is likely inspired by hindu mythology.
>Luffy, prior to the reveal regarding Nika being a freedom-loving sun god, was explicitly compared to a god once during Wano; he was referred to resembling a guardian deity while in Gear 4th, specifically Bùdòng Míngwáng (chapter 990). This s vaguely important because while guardian deities are well known, it's notable because Luffy has, well, a DF related to a in-universe deity, but we have a established base of sorts; Oda is working in the framework of eastern religions when he's coming up with his in-universe deities
>Joyboy's only living companion is Zunisha, a giant elephant, was his companion; hinduism has a concept known as Vahana, which is basically a divine mount which often has bizarre features and often have their own stories (such as being demons forced into service, ect).
>There's a modest chance for Joyboy to be partially inspired by a Javanese king named Jayabaya; Jayabaya was a Javanese ruler who reigned over a golden age of prosperity and peace and who also created various prophecies, and was considered a incarnation of Vishnu in his lifetime due to being considered a Ratu Adil, or prophesied hero-figure . This is mostly notable because Jayabaya figured into Imperial Japanese propaganda when they occupied Java during WW2 as someone who supposedly predicted the occupation of Java under the Japanese as a positive for the Javanese

I have one and I've never really seen anyone else talk about it. I think I brought this up on the chan once or twice long ago.

Anyways, during the Las Vegas shooting or right after it had happened, I was on YouTube looking at whatever. Randomly on my YouTube homepage there was a listing for some guy that was live streaming in Vegas so I decided to check it out and see what was going on.

The guy was going around to victims that were shot and basically filmed them and kind of played with their bodies. Nothing too crazy. Just kind of shaking them or moving them like he had never seen a dead person in real life and was mesmerized by it. A few times blood would poor out of their mouth and he would just go silent and sit there probably awestruck.

That reminds me. He was talking to these people he was recording too. He would go up to groups of people that were surrounding a person on the ground. They looked like they were going into shock because their mate or friend or whatever got hit. He would approach them and say "is he/she hit? I'm a ems tech. Show me where they are hit so I can help." And then he would proceed to do nothing or shake them like I previously mentioned. I remember him even doing it to single people that were in the process of dying. >>33740064
All this thing does is create a random number and slap it into a filename that has the structure used by default in a few different digital cameras.
Camera types and filename structure
"dcp#####.jpg" - Kodak, range of 0 to 4000
"dsc#####.jpg" - Nikon, range of 0 to 4000
"dscn####.jpg" - Nikon, range of 0 to 4000
"mvc-###.jpg" - Sony Mavica
"mvc#####.jpg" - Sony Mavica
"P101####.jpg" - Olympus, Using default camera date of 101
"PMDD####.jpg" - Olympus, M is in hex from 1 to c, DD is 01-31
"IMG_###.jpg" - Some other camera
"IMAG####.jpg" - RCA and Samsung
"1##-####.jpg" - Canon 1TH-TH## thousands, hundreds
"1##-####_IMG.jpg" - Alternate Canon name. MUCH thanks to Donald
"IMG_####.jpg" - Canon
"_MG_####.jpg" - Canon raw conversion. Thanks to Ira
"dscf####.jpg" - Fuji Finepix
"pdrm####.jpg" - Toshiba PDR
"IM######.jpg" - HP Photosmart
"EX######.jpg" - HP Photosmart timelapse?
"DC####S.jpg" - Kodak DC-40,50,120 S is (L)arge, (M)eduim, (S)mall. Thanks to Pholph
"pict####.jpg" - Minolta Dimage. Thanks to Bram
"P#######.JPG" - Kodak DC290. Thanks to Peter
"MMDD####.JPG" - Casio QV3000 and QV4000. Thanks to Fabian
"YYMDD###.JPG" - Casio QV7000 - M is hex. Thanks to Kimble
"IMGP####.JPG" - Pentax Optio S. Thanks to Matthew
"PANA####.JPG" - Panasonic video camera stills. Thanks to DeAnne
"IMG_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.JPG" - HTC Desire Z (AKA Tmobile G2). Thanks to anonymously vociferous

> Please be careful though. this is basically a form of very random chaos magick, and what you find may be meaningful to you or fuck you up. happy randonauting!

i can't remember the website(s) or even the exact year, but i must have been between 10 and 12 years old, so 2006ish. i hadn't become a full blown internet weirdo yet, but my time on the internet was spent in weird ways. rather than looking for porn like a normal person i'd surf for info on how to work with electronics, ancient history, weird conspiracy shit. one night i wound up finding an article somewhere that was about human sacrifices happening at the vatican. at that age i hadn't developed my bullshit detector yet so i freaked out pretty bad. the thought of it all made me nauseous, then i started getting paranoid as if i was told some secret information and they were going to come after me for knowing about it. i didn't sleep well for a couple of days at least, and i didn't tell my parents or anyone because i already knew i was a weird kid and i didn't want to get in trouble for being extra weird.

i never grew out of the conspiracy stuff but i obviously forgot about this one and after a while i would have laughed at the idea of people making human sacrifices ... and then here we are today where it's essentially common knowledge that things that fucked up are actually happening around the world. i wish i had some way of finding that site and reading it through adult eyes. it may have been a vatican whistleblower or it may have been some schizo who thinks catholics are evil because his pastor said so. anyone remember reading anything like that back then?

>When did you stop trusting synchronicities in your life?
When they started interrupting me, and having conflicting messages.

They pop up most often when I work on my music. I'm trapped in a debt prison somewhere in California, and most of my family and friends have abandoned me, even though they always seem happy when I'm around.
I holed myself up where I live now in order to work on music, because I thought I could help the world and my family and myself that way with important messages and truths.

At first, the synchronicities appeared playfully, without too much info, but partially warmly, I'd say.
But after a few years, they would interrupt me while I was at the gym, or while I was practicing music, popping up constantly in the middle of me doing things, with diminishing information.

For awhile I thought I could patiently wait, and I'd hear some kind of higher guidance speaking to me to offer help, but that basically stopped.
There are now conflicting messages,
There is some higher power that basically guides me towards loving people and growing as a spirit,
and another one that pushes me towards making more music, and aggressively taking what I want out of the material world.

Neither of them appears to try to make clear which side they are on.
For the most part, the synchronicities appear now to interrupt me when I practice or when I try to get healthy or workout. Basically whenever I put in effort or start cultivating discipline, which I am very capable of doing- but I don't always have. They show up exactly at the right time to throw me off balance, right when I'm pushing myself to my limits to establish control of myself and discipline, that's when they will interrupt and knock me off course.

After awhile of that, without any explanations, I grew pretty resentful.
I didn't know what they wanted, and couldn't get answers.

He was a glowie. He was involved with the Soviet secret police in Leninist Russia. The network of Cheka spooks he was involved with had connections with British intelligence and Oriental freemasonry. He was accused of working for British intelligence for a time.

https://www.bibliotecapleyades.net/sociopolitica/sociopol_shambahla15.htm

He was also a family friend of Stalin. In his journal Stalin says he stayed at Gurdjieff's family's house for six months when he studied at university. (Both him and Gurdjieff went to the same university, btw.) He also met and talked with the Nazi foreign policy strategist Karl Haushofer before the war. Dietrich Bronder in his book "Before Hitler Came" claims that that he inspired Haushofer to use the counter-clockwise Swastika as the nazi symbol. The dude definitely got around.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Living donation involves the transplantation of organs and tissues from a living donor. The following organs and tissues are suitable for donation:

Kidney and liver
People can donate a kidney or a part of their liver while alive. Read more about kidney donation and liver donation on the website of the Dutch Transplant Foundation.
T
issues
Sometimes after an operation there is some tissue left over which cannot be put back into the body, e.g. the head of the thigh bone after a total hip replacement. This is called residual material and it is potentially suitable for donation.
Stem cells

In stem cell transplantation, a doctor removes stem cells from the blood of a healthy donor. A donor can donate stem cells to patients with leukaemia or another form of blood cancer. Blood and blood plasma

Donated blood is vitally important for patients who have lost a lot of blood, for example, during childbirth or in an accident. Men can donate blood up to 5 times a year. For women this is up to 3 times a year, as they have lower body iron reserves.
Donating blood plasma is less stressful for the body than donating blood. First a machine separates the blood cells from the plasma, after which the plasma stays in the machine and the donor’s blood cells are returned to their body.

Homo Erectus was an aquatic ape. uprightness is an adaptation to swimming and living a semi aquatic life. also this is intuitively obvious and provable: that the actual speciation which occurs among higher apes is the ability to swim and stand upright and not ethnicity. This difference has the tendency throughout history to form a hierarchical distinction of casts that are codependent. When I say swim I do not mean dog paddle or like Michael Phelps, but as a method that is only possible with a fully upright resting posture more like a frog. There is nothing incorrect or pathological about the depiction of Akhenaten (Fish-King/god/pharaoh). He is just a good example of an upright ape. The last known exemplar presenting as is

Homo Erectus no longer exists or appears to us as an independent self-sustaining population, but among us like a genetic afterglow maintaining itself as a distribution of dominant recessive traits concentrating occasionally in single random occurrences and small populations of people with certain immune profiles much like Neanderthal. So we can say it is a complex mixture or hybridization of types and can be reproduced as such and is. What we call Homo Erectus is therefore the event we point to in which the ape survived by standing upright and this event is still occurring. Uprightness is the most robust configuration for optimal cognitive function. He is the ape that can swim away from the lion and was often the only one to survive. I am an upright ape just an animal passing by. But I don't claim to be king of the jungle. Just the ape that always gets away.

>>33742794
It would seem you would be indeed a quivk learner but also have difficulty with concentration and focus even when you know you should get to work on something and set yourself at the desk.

To better study, it would be good to, instead of procrastinating, integrate your personal research time and your study time and bounce back and forth. Trying to exclusively focus upon work for a session without the pressure of an imminent deadline may result in agitation to the point of abandoning studying altogether. So when studying alone, it might be good to spend 10 minutes on fun stuff, then switch to ten minutes of studying, then another break, etc.---making use of "breaks" but instead thinking of it as just doing both at the same time: multitasking.

You may also benefit from studying in a small group who have enough discipline not to let the study sessions get derailed.

>>33740539
That period of time, you may experience yourself feeling an odd, faint sense of melancholy. Ypu may dwell about problems occurring in your life and any that might be cropping up in the project. The mood may get depressive at times, but in that particular span of a few weeks or so that you've selected, you may feel a distinct motivation to push through no matter what.

You may experience it like the bounce of a ball. You fall and hit the ground, but immediately rise back up and continue going upward and onward.

You must be naturally adept at problem-solving, perhaps surprisingly anal and detail-oriented. You should have an affinity for the use of metrics and data. My recommendation would be to keep close tabs on the metrics of the development of your project and have a good sense of what anomalies are so that you can quickly formulate plans to squash them when they arise.

Also don't neglect self-care. Keep your office space very fresh and envigorating. Think about investing in scented candles or incense, noise-cancelling headphones with ocean waves ambience, plenty of coffee and water, a comfortable seat, well-ventilated workspace, and regular food.

If you have teammates you may be liable to rubbing them the wrong way or getting cross with them about something or other. Keeping yuorself personally pleased will allow you to keep work frustrations and life frustrations completely separate and allow you to better judge whatever conflicts arise in the workplace for what they are. People can be overly sensitive so you need to be prepared to be an adult and show them where they're wrong, responsibly.

>>33759132
Aquarius sun and ascendant both mean you're influenced by Aquarius energy. Your sun sign is your core identity, while your ascendant is how you present yourself to the world and your outer personality.

If you have an Aquarius sun, you'll probably be a rebel with a strong sense of self. You might be seen as unconventional or nonconformist, and you'll probably be really innovative and open-minded. You might be drawn to activities that allow you to think outside the box.

If you have an Aquarius ascendant, you'll PRESENT yourself as independent and offbeat. You might have a quirky or eccentric appearance, and you'll approach life and new experiences in a unique way. You might be detached and objective in your initial reactions to people and situations.

Your sun will show more in your sense of self, and your ascendant will show more in how you present yourself to the world.

BUT That said, it's not just you presenting it, people around you will see it magically due to astrology bullshit. Even if you're not quirky in any way, they'll still perceive you as it. For example, I'm a Leo rising, and I'm Capricorn sun. For whatever fucking reason, even if I'm in the back of the room all eyes go on me even though I don't want that at all. People just assume all the leo archetypes for me even though I'm a reclusive observer/background worker.

posts.com:
Very minor happening but I’ll keep it short and sweet

>finish closing down restaurant at end of a shift with friend/roommate
>he drives back to house and I ride my bicycle
>city’s laid out so that it’s often faster to bike than to drive, even with no traffic in the middle of the night like it was then
>i get home first and leave my bike propped up after entering, and using my phone’s flashlight, I do a quick sweep of each room of the house to check for spooky burglars or intruders
>i don’t turn on any lights and it is fully dark apart from my phone and my bike light which is still on
>make a loop of house which means 1st living room, 2nd living room, bedrooms, kitchen, back room, then back thru kitchen to get back to 1st living room, in that order
>while i am coming back through the kitchen, about five steps away from being back in the doorway of the 1st living room, I hear the distinct flicking sound of our lamp’s switch
>I jump a little bit because spooked, and then make it to the doorway to look into the 1st living room to see our lamp now on
>don’t know how long I stood staring at the lamp but probably less than 30 second later, my roommate pulls into the driveway and less than a minute from then he enters the front door
>I’m still standing there staring and spooked and i explain it to him
>we conclude that it was weird

it is a famously “haunted” city, and that is the closest I came to experiencing it as far as I can tell. Thanks for reading my uneventful but honest-as-possible tale

Not a story were anything really happens, but I´ve found an area that really feels...well, not "evil", but "bad" and everytime I visit, something slightly weird happens.
>be me, visiting girlfriends family, only for the 4th time in 7 years
>general area near the border of germany and both belgium and the netherlands
>also, interestingly enough, the very same area of the "boarrider"-greentext that ALWAYS gets reposted in these threads
>I take daily walks because I´m neither a family person, nor a very social person, so I need my me-time
>first time I visit there, I find a cut-down-tree in the middle of the forest, not even remotely close to any road or fields. It´s painted red, with immense red nails stuck in the top, holding a detailed human heart made from metal pieces
>second time visiting there, I awake in the middle of the night, people in robes are standing outside of the house the street over, some with instruments, some with torches, singing in front of the open door.
>third visit, I take a break on one of my walks, sit down on the stairs to a windmill, listen to music and read a bit. Three other wanderers walk by, just stop in front of me and stare at me for literaly 5 minutes without a word or even answering my "good day", then keep going. Happens two more times in the next hour before I get seriously freaked out and go home.
>fourth visit, same specific area where I found the "heart" and was observed by the weird wanderers, this time I find weird pieces of hap-hazardly built fences between trees in the forest, not even knee-high and completely useless, dozens of them. Last one I found was round instead of being set up between two trees and had this weird Golem-looking mud-puppet lying right in the middle.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:

Those are not the only "weird" things that happened to me, there, but by far the most significant, everything else was very minor but adding to the feeling of wrongness.
I´m not an easily frightened person, but always get sudden pangs of intense fears when I walk around there.
I also always feel watched, both in the woods and in the cities around, hell, even when driving on the road.
Last visit was just last week, by the way.

Sex positivity is viewing sex in a positive light, usually not involving marriage and sex positivity is an obvious form of degeneracy. Bug chasing and bug spreading is sometimes a form of sex positivity.
Age regression is a disgusting form of transformation art (usually stories or pictures where people undergo some type of metamorphosis) where the characters become younger. This is usually a fetish and can including characters that are of age de-aging to become minors, although there are AR pieces where someone becomes younger but not a minor such as for example a story of an elderly person regressing to their 20s or 30s. Dark fiction is stories usually involve acts such as rape, murder and other related crimes or general dystopias. It isn't always wrong, but can be especially if getting off to fiction about cannibalism or whatever.

>What are your beliefs about extraterrestrial life?

Simple extraterrestrial life such as algaes, planktons, amoebas, maybe even simple surface vegetation, is probably very common- maybe even abundant. I wouldn't be surprised if such organisms were found in subterranean Mars, underneath the ice of Europa, and in the atmosphere of Venus. Life seems to be extremely persistent, adaptable, and essentially impossible to permanently eliminate once conceived.
I'm expecting complex extraterrestrial life (things with bones) to be far less common, but not exactly rare. Animals might be a "once per solar system" kind of occurrence: only propagating on the most consistent climate-controlled kind of "goldilocks" planet in a given system. I don't agree with speculative biologists. At all. Alien animals will most likely be very similar to what we've already witnessed with Earth animals. It's like how Dinosaurs all evolved from a different common ancestor to Mammals, but despite this Dinosaurs and Mammals still developed into very similar creatures because they still ultimately needed to do and survive the same conditions and some designs are just "the meta".

I'm fuckin' DYING, I'm SHITTING, to know if Alien life and Earth life either share a common ancestor or each biosphere is independently developed and uniquely "original content" per planet that essentially has to be made from scratch each time.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33748589
yeah, this. also, each day/month/year is continually growing shorter in relation to your total time spent on this earth.
one year for a two year old is 50% of their life, but one year for a twenty year old is 5% of their life.
let yourself be bored more often, or do things that move you away from your routine.
if you do the same thing every day, then it's obvious that at some point they'll melt together and an entire year can feel like one very long, blurry day.
you don't have to adopt the "yolo live every day like its your last" mindset and go to the extremes of literally living each day differently, but you could break your time into chunks, if that makes sense.
so, for me, something that helps me "slow down" my clock is by breaking things up into the seasons. in the spring, i spend a lot of time preparing my garden.
during summer, i spend a lot of time outside both enjoying my garden and tending to it. i also spend a lot of time 'experiencing the world' by going camping, on bike rides, walks at night
in the autumn, i start to harvest the majority of what i've planted (lots of smaller things get harvested throughout the year), then i start cleaning everything and putting it into compost.
then, i use winter as a time to hunker down and reflect.

basically, enrich your life with more variety but also give yourself time to be bored and do nothing. then you'll actually enjoy the mundane and it won't morph itself into some weird caricature.

I made a thread about this a few weeks ago, because I noticed it too. Nothing conclusive was reached (tons of people saying "it's just you getting old bro"), but a good point is that the usual memonics for counting time like 1-mississippi-2mississippi are off by about 30%, and people in general feel like time flows about 30% faster.

I have no idea what is going on, but I do wonder about some things:

>2 Peter 3:11-23
>11Since everything is to be dissolved in this way, what sort of persons ought [you] to be, conducting yourselves in holiness and devotion, 12[a]waiting for and hastening the coming of the day of God, because of which the heavens will be dissolved in flames and the elements melted by fire.

>Matthew 24:21-22
>21For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be. 22And except those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect's sake those days shall be shortened.

> Daniel 7:25
> And he shall speak great words against the most High, and shall wear out the saints of the most High, and think to change times and laws: and they shall be given into his hand until a time and times and the dividing of time.

>Since everything is to be dissolved
>dissolved in flames and the elements melted by fire.
>hastening the coming of the day of God
2 Peter describes what sounds like a fundamental breakdown of the laws of physics holding things together. The 'hastening' is usually interpreted as doing things to fulfill the prophecy, but what if it's suggesting time starts breaking down too?

>those days should be shortened
Again, the usual interpretation is that God ordained a period of tribulation, then cut it by some amount so the elect should survive, but that's a weird bit of indecision. What if he adjusted the flow of time so people are 'gimped' and can't do as much during that period, partly so we don't wipe ourselves out with biotech for example.

>Feel free to suggest resources
Resources:
Books:
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel
https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams
No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission. Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason
https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. Part grimoire, part reverence. Contains art and accounts by different people.

Videos:
Who is Lilith? Ancient Origins by Esoterica
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
A fairly extensive history on her historical origins
The Untold Truth of Lilith by Grunge
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
A short video intended for a popular audience
Goes over her myth and general nature
Goddess Lilith - What she likes, how to contact
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
A simple, short to the point video that rings true to my experiences.
My Experiences Workiing with Lilith
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks
One woman's account of her experience

For me it's been partially the opposite. Since working with her recently, I've been confronted with bisexual urges, and I'm still unsure how to reconcile them. It hasn't gotten to the point of feeling attracted to women in person, but nonetheless, my spiritual experiences lately have me questioning my sexual orientation.

It's embarrassing to admit, but I used to find women somewhat repulsive. I've always admired those who exemplify masculine virtues, and often saw women as the opposite, taking advantage of men's strength like parasites, subconsciously seducing their will just to satisfy their own needs. And I felt deeply ashamed of my sexuality as I recognised that same neediness within myself.

Even so, I still had to deal with gender dysphoria somehow. I already sought help from others when I was 14, but even then I could only wait as I lost things that felt important to me. But when I was 17, perhaps in a lapse of judgement, I turned to the occult. It was just a prayer to attempt to form a pact, and not even directed towards anyone in particular. But since then, my life began to change drastically, and I found relief that I didn't even think was possible.

As the wish I'd once made reached a satisfactory conclusion, and Lilith offered to guide me towards a new purpose, I thanked her and began to show my appreciation for her more. I thought I accepted myself now that I'm finally at peace with my body, only to feel lost again as spiritual experiences confront me with all sorts of sides of myself that I don't know how to reconcile. I'd have been content to ignore them for the rest of my life, but now I'm unsure how I'm supposed to proceed anymore. And although I recall her offer to guide me, I'm reluctant as I fear I'll be forced to face even more.

That's what I get for being dishonest with myself; for being so easily seduced as my contradictions are exposed.

>>33737944
I always struggled to relate to transgender people. Dysphoria was primarily a physical thing for me that ceased after my surgery, so I find the focus on stereotypes asinine and childish.

Two years ago, my older brother asked me to strangle his neck as hard as I can. He was curious if his neck muscles are stronger than my arms. I refused as it made me uncomfortable.
A year later, I felt scared as I realised how weak I am physically. But when I told my fiancé that I wanted to try building abs to boost my confidence, he was against it; he said he dislikes muscles on women. I lost motivation, as I realised I can never be as strong as him anyway.

I dislike alcohol, but knowing I'm way too hard on myself, I drank half a glass of champagne yesterday, hoping it would loosen me up a bit. The results were as agonising as I expected. It was far too little for me to lose control, but it became slightly harder for me to suppress my unwanted emotions. As they raged inside of me, I snuck away from my family and isolated myself. I forced myself to remain silent and still, but the storm inside only worsened.

When I returned, my brother noticed I was tense. He said to let out my anger by hugging him as hard as I can. So I embraced him, as if trying to crush him.
In that moment, I felt glad I'm physically weak. "I don't have to hold back. I don't have be afraid I'll hurt others, if this is all I can do", I thought.
But then, he said repeatedly: "You're strong. Those hormones didn't affect you nearly as badly as I thought." He sounded so relieved.

My brother is the strongest man I know. If I can be strong in his eyes even without training after 7 years of having less testosterone than most women, then I shouldn't belittle myself.
So I've decided to start working out and learn martial arts. It doesn't matter if I won't be as strong as I'd have been as a man; transitioning gave me other things that are more important to me. Even so, I still want to become my best self.

I attempted physical transmutation a few years ago, as I was curious whether it might work. However, I discontinued my efforts after a few weeks, as it caused severe inflammation and pieces of dead skin falling off in a particular area. Not only was the pain becoming unbearable, but I realised what I was doing was highly dangerous, as it was becoming difficult to even urinate. After discontinuing my magick, which consisted of daily energy work in a deep trance, the symptoms subsided in just a day.

My conclusions are that it's far more efficient to change physical things by physical means, and spiritual things by spiritual means. Not only that, but it's dangerous to attempt to remove body parts with magick; it's no different from convincing those parts of your body to destroy themselves, with no guarantee of actually getting the results you want. In my experience, physical surgery is both safer and much less painful in comparison. However, based on other results I got such as a sudden spurt of breast growth, I do think it can be useful for healing.

You posted here a while ago and clarified that you're not interested in physically transitioning, nor in changing spiritually. Perhaps it could be useful for you to try to understand why you think you want to be a biological woman, and find (other) positive ways for you to fulfil the underlying needs.

Months ago I saw a thread here about a teacher complaining how his students did nothing, they didn't talk with each other, the disliked TV and movies, they couldn't care less about homework, basically dead inside-people.
So, a few days ago I found a dude, we were from the same classroom but he left after 1 year, and he said this: "I don't know how you did it, their vibe was different and it was something odd."
So, my class had like ~40 students and only 4 had any activity outside school. I was into foreign languages and swimming, a friend was into boxing and working out, a girl used to go to dancing classes (she's an amazing dancer) and another girl was really into church (protestant) and playing music.
So then I finished school and started to meet other people only to find out my school was very odd indeed. While talking with people I discovered they had bands, dancing groups and other types of activities in their schools and group of friends. I discovered people are passionate about things, and how that fear or looking dumb doesn't exist when surrounded by other passionate people.
While remembering this, there was a religious event in church after a kid died and people got surprised I was able to "respond" the priest during the Catholic mass since I used to go to church too. Teachers used to complain our class was the worst because we were too cynical and how we disliked school trips, my teachers were shit people too.
I'm starting to thinking I was in a classroom full of the last men Nietzsche wrote about it.

Deus Ex is a fantastic game. I'm old enough that I played it when it came out, but I recently replayed it a few weeks ago. The story and detail of the conspiracies and a lot of the dialogue if you keep asking people is phenomenal.

The reason it predicted so much stuff is not because of predictive programming or the devs having secret knowledge, it's because they literally read conspiracy books of the time (stuff like Behold A Pale Horse had come out a few years before) and put everything in it.

The fact that conspiracy theorists are right about almost everything (as we've seen in the last 3 years) is why Deus Ex was so prophetic.

There is no way Deus Ex could be made now, there are too many people waking up to the truth. Back in the 90s these conspiracy theories were fringe knowledge known by crazies, whereas now we are in the ideological war stage and living in a dystopia of censorship and media control.

Protip: The parts of Deus Ex that you like were written by Sheldon J. Pacotti. He was the writer for the dialogue on Deus Ex 1 (all the red pilled shit you hear and the philosophy dork enlightenment stuff that /pol/ posts a lot.) He was the lead writer for IW and storywise it shows. It's honestly one of the most thought-provoking games I ever played storywise. Unfortunately, it's tied to a shitty game. IW is basically the revelation of the method, but it's so brutally honest about it that you admire it. It's basically saying all future choices suck, and while it wants you to take the Helios choice, it in no uncertain terms tells you it sucks and they all lead to roughly the same outcome besides the Templar ending. But I really think the Omar ending was secretly canon because it's off the beaten path and it's a bit more difficult to achieve (games easy regardless) than the other endings. It's also the only one narrated and basically says humanity reaches the stars, but at a heavy cost (you get your freedom and a good ending down the line, but you pay for it dearly.)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33760756
Unconditional love is the choice to strive for the well-being of another. The feeling you derive from acting with love is your reward, the return you “get” from your own action.
To love unconditionally is to act with love under all conditions.
If you have to do something, or be a certain way, in order to receive love, that love is conditional. If it is given to you freely and without reservation, it is unconditional.

You must be able to recognize, accept, and forgive your own imperfections in order to do the same for someone else. If you cannot deem yourself worthy of being loved unconditionally, you’ll never truly be able to deem yourself worthy of offering it.

In religious terms, you’ll hear the phrase “hate the sin, love the sinner.” Loving someone unconditionally does not mean liking every action they take or choice they make; it means not letting such things interfere with your desire for the best for that person in all things.[9]
If someone you love says something hurtful in anger, the loving choice is usually to let them know those words hurt you, but also to forgive their indiscretion. Help them to grow and yet know that they are loved.
But don't mistake being willing to forgive for letting people walk all over you. Extricating yourself from an environment in which you are repeatedly mistreated or taken advantage of can be a loving choice for both yourself and the other person.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
What is the second greatest command? If you’re a believer, a student of Scripture, it’s possible that you said something like “Love your neighbor as yourself.” If you did, you’d be right - almost.

Jesus himself said, “Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind. This is the first and greatest commandment. And the second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ ” (Matthew 22:37-39, ESV). And this was Jesus’ response to the question, “Which is the greatest commandment in the Law?” -referring, of course, to the Law of Moses.

Until Jesus came, the second greatest command as stated in the Old Testament (Leviticus 19) was completely adequate. In fact, I think it was the best we could hope for in terms of loving another human being. This is The Golden Rule (Matthew 7:12): Do unto others as you would have them do unto you.

But throw into the mix the fact that sometimes we don’t even love ourselves. Sometimes we can truly struggle to like what we are, who we are, and certainly what we do. How can we be expected to love others as we love ourselves if we don’t even know how to love ourselves? There are days when many of us struggle just to be nice to ourselves. So how can we love better?

Jesus gives the answer.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33760918
In the gospel of John, Jesus said, “A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another: Just as I have loved you, you also are to love one another.” (John 13:34, ESV). Jesus has raised the bar. Not that he has made it more difficult to love (quite the contrary: With this command he also promises to pour out the love of God into our hearts by the Holy Spirit, thus enabling us to love beyond human capacity), butthe idea of love itself has beenraised!

No longer are we called to love others as we would like to be loved, as we desire to be loved, as we are able to humanly love. Now, with Jesus’ advent, we are called to love others with self-sacrifice -to actually consider others better than ourselves (Philippians 2). Jesus said that no greater love can be expressed than the willingness to lay down your life for another person.This is exactly what Jesus did. In showing us the greatest gift of self-sacrifice through the cross, Jesus teaches us how to love like God loves. And, through his resurrection, Jesus shows us that such love is vindicated! I pray that each of us might take a moment to really ponder this revision of the second greatest command. Love your neighbor as Jesus has loved you. Elections, Thanksgiving and Christmastime with relatives and in-laws: These events offer us plenty of opportunities to live out the revised commandment.

May we love God. May we love others. May we love as Jesus loves.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
What does Scripture tell us about how we are to interact with others? 1 John 4:20 says, “… the one who does not love his brother whom he has seen, cannot love God whom he has not seen.” And Jesus told us to “… love your neighbor as yourself.’”

By “brother” and “neighbor” Jesus doesn’t just mean our family or the people who happen to live in our same neighborhood. He literally means everyone — our family, neighbors, strangers, even our enemies. Which means we have our work cut out for us.

I’m still struggling to love my brothers and sisters in Christ. But I’m supposed to love everyone? Why would Jesus give such a hard assignment? Because He knows we’re capable of doing so, with His help.

Is my casual friendliness “love?” Or is it just a warm and fuzzy feeling because I happen to know and like these people? How can I make sure I offer real love - His - love to all people?

In a very practical way, Mother Teresa provided a great example of how to love like Jesus.

In her work with the poor, the Nobel Peace Prize recipient followed Christ’s call to feed the hungry and clothe the naked, to visit the imprisoned, to care for the homeless and the sick. In doing so, she met their deeper need for love and dignity:

>> The hungry “hunger not only for bread, but for love. For the tender concern of someone who cares.”

>> Clothe the naked, “and not only with a piece of cloth, but with that beautiful dignity of a child of God. Dignity for someone who has been created to be loved and to love.”

>> Tend to the sick who are sick “not only in body, but sick at heart.”

Can you imagine Jesus walking past you or me with just a nod or casual wave? No way! Jesus would look straight into our soul and pierce our heart with His love. We would have no doubt that He really saw us — and that in His eyes, we have immeasurable worth.

Let's talk about the power of tattoos.
I have a few hand poked tattoos on one of my arms and one of my legs, all done myself. Enough to be noticeable but not enough to be a "tattoo guy"
I started doing them out of boredom/depression/drunkenness. Mostly they are random geometric patterns, runes and little symbols or letters.
Some I love, some I like, some I have grown to like, some stick out like a sore thumb and need to be surrounded by others and/or changed into something else to make them less ugly.
I feel that they are a powerful device. I like the power of art on the observer, and tattoos are a particularly potent form of art, which will affect the wearer for the rest of their life.
I see them as messages and reminders to myself as well as an expression of my identity and creativity.
Over time I have gotten a sense of power they can have, both positive and negative. One time I was tripping on acid staring at my arm and I can't really express the emotion that I felt, but it was a defining moment in my life.

Picrel is one of the runes I have on my arm. Interestingly I created it by accident, playing with random shapes. My vague idea was to draw a fish. Only later did I find out its meaning. Othala - heritage, inheritance, home. A good meaning for one of my favourites.
Unfortunately I found out that it is also a far right symbol and it also looks a bit too much like a swastika, and it makes me feel self conscious for that reason. So I will change it to a Tetris block and put the rune somewhere less visible.

I plan to do a few more runes.

Tell me about your thoughts on tattoos

According to some Buddhist sutras, when someone enters into a state of 'samadhi' (a flow state, one pointed concentration) this has the potential to be right or 'wrong'. It is 'wrong' samadhi if it does not ease your suffering and still your mind.
According to chaos magicians, that flow state is the bedrock of which magic is built. It is called gnosis in those circles.
The skandhas are ways you experience reality around you. The feeling skandha has to do with all sensory experience, pleasant or unpleasant.
Now, according to all Buddhist traditions, ones suffering begins when they identify with and cling to their skandha as a self.
However, some Buddhist suttas go further. They say that someone who enters into samadhi can become 'possessed' by their skandha. Essentially obsessed with it. The flower sutra breaks this down into fifty 'demonic states', revolving around the five skandhas.
You are possessed by the skandha of feeling. Meaning you're obsessed with sensory experience, and particularly the demon state of lust. When you're like this, you will look for literally anything to satisfy the lustful urges you have. Which continue to get more and more upsetting and extreme, as well as obtuse. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Every idea of lack arises from a context.
To transcend lack is not about transcending the idea itself, which is only a symptom. You must transcend the entire context from which that lack arises.

For example, if you try to transcend hunger by envisioning a world in which everyone has food, then you're still accepting the context from which hunger arises (the need to consume "food") and hunger will return in some form.
If you try to transcend slavery by envisioning some complex system of rules to prevent people from exploiting others, then again you're still accepting the context of slavery because such rules have no meaning outside of a world that doesn't already allow that exploitation.

The negative controlling entities know this. They don't care how much you fight back, even if you win, because in the process you're accepting the context of their control.
BUT at the same time it's not about being passive either, because passivity also resides within the same context.
And this leads to so much confusion from spiritual teachings that sound like they're teaching passivity when really that's not the point. It only seems like it when you're focused on the symptom rather than the real cause. The real point is to reject the context.

This is also why manifestation is so difficult, because it requires you to deal with the symptoms of a pre-existing negative context while simultaneously rejecting it and trying to form a new one.

You don't manifest the rejection, the rejection is a part of how you manifest something different.
Rejecting it just means seeing clearly that it's not something you want, that it doesn't serve you in any way, and believing that other ways are possible.
I believe simply doing that already aligns your soul with a path that leads out of the system. How long it takes I suppose depends on spiritual development.

>>33764703
I think it doesn't actually look like a "union" at all. It think it's more like just moving on entirely from those concepts.

For example, say you're a child playing a game that says every person is either an X or a Y, and you divide yourselves into groups and claim others (even people not playing the game) are X's or Y's.
One day you may just outgrow the game and go do something else, and your friends will come and ask if you're still an X or a Y. When you say "neither" they just scratch their heads, and maybe try to rationalize that what you mean is "both" because they can't understand anything but being X or Y.
But you just roll your eyes and don't fucking care, because X and Y were just made-up things to begin with.
You didn't overcome them by becoming the "union" you just stopped playing the game entirely.

And that's what context does. Your friends are stuck seeing everything in the context of the X-Y game, so their thinking is restricted by that context.
When you outgrow it and move on you've freed yourself from the context that duality emerges out of.

>Who is Michael Aquino?

Michael A. Aquino was a lieutenant colonel of the US Army, and he was employed in the Army's psychological operations division in San Francisco. Aquino wrote the influential book on psychological operations called Mindwar.

Michael Aquino was also the founder and high priest of the Temple of Set, a satanist religious organization that broke away from the Church of Satan due to disputes that included the Temple of Set worshipping a literal Satan and practicing magic that is considered by members to have supernatural power. He was born in 1936 and died in 2019.

Information on Aquino has been scrubbed from the internet recently (https://www.reddit.com/r/conspiracy/comments/6wvpqy/lt_col_michael_aquino_was_scrubbed_from/). He has some connections to various occult conspiracies (the Finders, McMartin preschool), and this thread is the place where /x/philes get to the bottom of them.

>Why is there /x/ interested in him now?
There's been a somethingburger on him that was produced by a FOIA request I made. I received documents in response to the FOIA request, and they are available here: https://pastebin.com/3SQzFs98

People bitched about them being on a Discord in last thread, so there you go. To investigate them in real time, join the Discord: https://discord dot gg/x4K82F6fja

The files we've gotten so far show Aquino's connection to the a child sex-abuse case in 1986, where four children tested positive for Chlamydia at a daycare on the US Army base. They also show him trying to get the SFPD to stop investigating him.

But the interesting detail is how the FBI has abnormally large number of documents on him: nearly 5000 pages of files and 19 CDs worth of audio and video content. The government gives out some portion of files for free (the ones we got) and charges for the rest. I had to pay about 500 dollars for them, and they will first be posted in the Discord when I get my hands on them in a few days.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
You can absolutely be a christian wizard, but you need to do things that don't contradict with the teachings of christ. Summoning demons usually involves some incredibly arrogant or foolish actions, like attempt to bind them, make deals or bargain with them, or even letting them possess you or whatever. This is not a good idea for anyone and is certainly not christian in nature.

Praying to angels is however not a contradiction. There is no binding an angel (their master is god, not you), and there is no way you can negotiate or bargain with them to achieve some favor (they just want to be a good person and do good, so you can't bribe them with anything). So selfish and arrogant ways of dealing with angels simply don't make sense and don't work. Pray to them for guidance, wisdom, compassion, and especially courage (they love to tell people "don't be afraid").

The catholic church dealt with angel worship becoming more and more widespread, sometime around the 1500s if I recall corrrectly, and eventually banned the practice except for praying to the archangels specifically mentioned in the bible, meaning Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael. In the context of praying to these angels, you might pray to them for courage (michael), knowledge (gabriel), and healing (raphael). Sounds pretty good to me.

In this way, there is a big difference between a christian who seeks the guidance of angels and a demonologist (or witch, necromancer, etc) who summons demons to obtain a specific material advantage.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
part 2

Cursing people is also obviously not in keeping with christ's message, instead, a christian magician would try to bless them. Send out positive, healing energy, giving comfort to the afflicted and truth to misguided, always hoping they see the light and walk a good path. Remember it is not your job to decide punishments or carry out punishments for sinners, instead try to help them see the error of their ways and be a good friend to them. Just like you would normally, without using magic.

I see no contradiction here, assuming you stick to the teachings of christ and try to help people and become a better person.

There are certainly branches of christianity that deal with the more magical or "spooky" side of things, and you can look them up. You mentioned being a catholic, so I doubt you'd be interested in studying gnostic christianity, but it's there if you want to look it up. My opinions on gnostic christianity is there's about 33% outright heresy/misleading info, 33% nonsense, and 33% good stuff that you don't get from elsewhere in the mainstream branches of christianity, including catholicism of course. Your mileage may vary.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33764667
Energy work, lucid dreaming. Energy work as I mean it involves practicing meditation based on focussing on tactile sensations within the body. Start with light meditation, which is simply being relaxed, and tickle or scratch your foot, knee, hand, etc, then try to keep the sensation going. Move that sensation around your body. Then try to make sensations happen in your body without an initial aid, this leading to vibrations. Then work on deeper trance meditation, rather than simple relaxation.

Now read a book using this exact practice to achieve astral projection (energy work/deep trances/lucid dreaming). I read one a long time ago and don't remember its exact name. You will probably achieve other effects, in addition to, or to the exclusion of astral projection. I'm sorry to say there is no way to easy way to accomplish altered states of consciousness or out of body experiences, other than ingesting psychedelic drugs. But that just makes the beginning easy, and you still have a likely difficult/overwhelming journey ahead of you, and it could even be haunting/harrowing if you have a bad trip.

Mantras can also be used to aid in trance meditation, but the downside with that is once you go deep enough you won't be talking any more.

No shortcuts here my friend. Not sure if the above amounts to a "ritual" or "talking to yourself", but hard work lies before you even if you eschew rituals or mantras.

Love is real. But real love can't be harnessed with magic. Magic is found in real love. Like when you see a really beautiful sunset. It's natural and leaves no room for doubt.

Real love also hurts like a mother fucker. It will force you to grow and heal wounds you never acknowledged or knew about until it came along. And at the end of the day, might not even matter. Cause it takes two and if there is no proper communication, it's going to be a never ending cycle of triggers, confusion, and heartache. And being legit love, you'll want to throw yourself back in there every time.

Your Andrew Taint types will lean hard into the incel mind set. And it's an easy one to lean into. Simple just to blame your bad lot it life on a whole gender. And inner honest reflection upon oneself + facing ones wounds/shadow is uncomfortable. Especially if you are insecure and down on yourself already. People are flawed and the truth is, you're both going to be the problem at times. I'm far from an expert but I'd guess the answer in that is honest communication and a mutual desire to grow together (sans judgement).

To be vulnerable is to set oneself for hurt. You're exposing your heart. And real love requires vulnerability.

Right now, the only Hocus pocus magic I'd be interested in is one that gets her out of my head and my heart. Cause it hurts. But I don't hate her. I don't blame her. And at the end of the day, I know it's fruitless to even entertain such a thing. Cause I'd always find my way back to her. Sunshine of the Spotless Mind is a perfect analogy.

I'd just like to interject for a moment. What you're referring to as Kybalion, is in fact, Kybalion/Hermetics, or as I've recently taken to calling it, Kybalion plus Hermetics. Atkinson's "Kybalion" is not an initiatory system unto itself, but rather another free component of a fully functioning Hermetics system made useful by Franz Bardon's "Initiation into Hermetics", LoA and vital system components comprising a full Esoteric System as defined by Albert Pike in Morals and Dogma.

Many occultists run a modified version of the Kyablion metaphysics every day, without realizing it. Through a peculiar turn of events, the version of Kybalion which is widely used today is often called Hermetics, and many of its users are not aware that it is basically the Kybalion system, developed by the Three Initiates.

There really is a Hermetics, and these people are using it, but it is just a part of the system they use. Hermetics is initiatory activities: the actions in the system that allocates empowerment to the other experiments that you run. The metaphysics of Kybalion is an essential part of a mystical system, but useless by itself; it can only function in the context of a complete mystical system. Hermetics is normally used in combination with the Kybalion mystical system: the whole system is basically Kybalion with Initiation into Hermetics added, or Kybalion/Hermetics. All the so-called Hermetics are really distributions of Kybalion/Hermetics!

>5.14: The embodied spirit, master of the city of his body, does not create activities, nor does he induce people to act, nor does he create the fruits of action. All this is enacted by the modes of material nature.
>13.30: One who can see that all activities are performed by the body, which is created of material nature, and sees that the self does nothing, actually sees.

Here comes the concept of rtam,natural order. Is it a cow grazing,a lion hunting or a parent beating their child to teach them how to behave properly?. Then no intervention, because by intervening you'll disrupt progression of nature. Like a childbirth,mother must endure it.

However if it's a animal having a nail stuck in its foot ,or a child being beaten by their parent mercilessly without reason etc then intervention is necessary. Like a time when a baby has a deformity, it has to be aborted and the mother saved.

Furthermore, you must have the proper intelligence to see this rtam in nature. The most enlightened ones see this in the order even when great misery /pain is present and keep calm.


This is more of a vedic view as opposed to the later views that evolved.
